project.description: Super build configuration for pdfClown.org projects (DO NOT use directly: use pdfclown-common-base instead)

scripts.script:
import java.time.ZonedDateTime import java.time.ZoneOffset import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter import java.time.temporal.ChronoUnit
/* Timestamp for reproducible builds (see <https://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-reproducible-builds.html>).
NOTE: Reproducible builds are meaningful for SCM-traceable code only; therefore, the current commit's timestamp is used only if the working tree is clean. In case of dirty working tree, the timestamp is generated on the fly, following the volatility of the built code. */ var buildTimestamp = ${git.dirty} ? ZonedDateTime.now(ZoneOffset.UTC).truncatedTo(ChronoUnit.SECONDS) .format(DateTimeFormatter.ISO_INSTANT) : "${git.commit.time}"
project.properties.setProperty('buildTimestamp', buildTimestamp) /* NOTE: Here the magic happens: documented examples (see, e.g., https://github.com/groovy/GMavenPlus/wiki/Examples#dynamic-properties) cite only `project.properties` assignment but that doesn't work for dynamic reference substitution (i.e., "{..}" syntax); peering into the source code of git-commit-id-maven-plugin (whose dynamic property references work perfectly), we can see that its property assignments are propagated also to `session.userProperties` (see https://github.com/git-commit-id/git-commit-id-maven-plugin/blob/34d009cc1c18dda05aeb843fa0983b4fbcff5222/src/main/java/pl/project13/maven/git/GitCommitIdMojo.java#L1415). */ session.userProperties.setProperty('buildTimestamp', buildTimestamp)
log.info("buildTimestamp: " + buildTimestamp + " (" + (${git.dirty} ? "DIRTY" : "REPRODUCIBLE") + ")")
